Job Title: Sr. Director, Strategic Planning & Enterprise Risk Management 

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Consulting, Finance, Strategy/Planning

Description:
Sr. Director, Strategic Planning & Enterprise Risk Management 
We are Radial, the leader in omnichannel commerce technology and operations. We enable our clients to profitability exceed customer expectations by taking on the complexity of their omnichannel retail business and transforming into a seamlessly orchestrated customer expectations.
To bring order to ordering, make fulfillment more fulfilling and keep commerce clicking, when we partner with our clients to execute their orders, payments, fulfillment or customer care, our clients' promises become ours. To learn more, visit https://www.radial.com
The Sr. Director of Strategic Planning & Enterprise Risk Management will play a dual role within Radial, serving as the organization’s key strategic partner specific to merger & acquisition needs, financial management, investments, risks and opportunities with a focus on driving key strategic financial processes as well as enterprise risk management (ERM) leader and connection point with bpost, our parent company.
Job Responsibilities:Strategic PlanningDrive comprehensive business plan recommendations to commercial teams and project owners.Support the translation of strategic plans into operational business plans and financial plans that support local market strategy and priorities, ensuring that commercial activities are aligned.Provide insightful analysis to support the conversion of the consumer journey into financials and integrate it into the business plan.Monitor and own business performance (for example, KPIs, competitors’ activities, volume trends) and translate insights into financial forecasts and recommendations.Drive the development of financial models/scenarios and ad hoc financial analysis to support management in their decision-making.Analyze channel performance and profitability.Support the preparation of presentations and reports aiming to give a clear and comprehensive reading of the business to stakeholders in the organization.Merger & Acquisition SupportProvide leadership and drive efforts to achieve growth through mergers, acquisitions, and divestitures; oversee activities to determine the feasibility of possible mergers and evaluate the potential impact on the corporation’s growth and profitability.Provide M&A thought leadership and expertise to strategically drive improved financial and business results.Lead M&A project management processes including due diligence, financial planning, scoping, closing, and integration.Enterprise Risk ManagementDevelop and maintain the ERM framework/policy concerning both strategic risk management and operational risk management.Coordinate and support strategic risk assessment, align risk appetite, and consolidate the results at the company level. Identify transversal risks that require a coordinated approach and ensure a mitigation plan together with the risk owner.Ensure an operational risk monitoring program is in place by selecting key processes in scope and defining the set of minimum controls that need to be implemented in line with a validated risk appetite definition; coordinate and oversee the implementation of the minimum controls; perform quality checks on the design and documentation of the locally implemented controls to comply with the minimum controls; coordinate and oversee the process of the yearly IC statements.Ensure coordination of the BCM (Business Continuity Management - the management process to oversee and implement strategies to address the risk of unexpected disruptions or crises and minimize the impact on business operations) and related Business Continuity Plan that the organization develops to perform the necessary actions to recover from unexpected disruptions and resume normal operations again.Experience:Bachelor's Degree preferred with marked experience in strategic financial planning and analysis. 10+ years of experience notably implementing finance & risk management frameworks and processes.Relevant experience working in a complex, preferably multi-national, stakeholder environment that includes complex customers and regulators.Ability to operate effectively within formal corporate governance frameworks (Risk Committee, Regulatory framework)Experience presenting and communicating at executive levels.Ability to demonstrate strategic vision and business understanding.Effective ability to influence stakeholder community at all level and effective communication skills to deal with largediverse customer base, internal and external.Open and collaborative management style while maintaining independence.Required expertise for the function: Risk Management and Internal control expertise.Technical knowledge required to perform the function: Risk Management, Internal Control, MS Office, GRC tooling.This position is not open to residents in CA, WA, NY & CO Radial is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.
Access this link to review our privacy notice: Radial, Inc. Privacy Notice for Candidates | Radial 
Radial is committed to ensuring that its online application process provides an equal employment opportunity to all job seekers, including individuals with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to submit an application, please contact us by emailing hroperations@radial.com. We will work to assist disabled job seekers whose disability prevents them from being able to apply online.
#LI-Remote

Experience Level (if available): Director
